column4: Hi everyone, is there any way of recovering data from a drive where the partition allocations have been wiped?
Anyone able to assist a semi-noob with a couple of issues?

My dad currently runs Windows. He has 2 physical HD's, an 80GB and a 120GB. Windows is on hda, hdb has backed up files on it. I booted using a genuine Ubuntu Dapper Drake 6.06 LTS disk, and tried to install as Dual Boot.

hdb has 80+GB free, so I just partitioned manually, and used the remaining free space to create a swap (700MB) and a ext "/" partition of the remaining space. All seemed OK, we his apply and it came to an error message part way through and said creation failed.
naw i have a root term open all the time
Now the drive has 3 paritions on it, all apparently "Unformatted" and I can't mount any of them using the Live disk to retreive the info.
Was that question to me WF?
sorry, yes it does still boot windows from the C:\ (hda) drive
so u mean  that the liveCD/installer failed?
The partitioning section of the install failed in the LiveCD mode, and aborted the partition prematurely.
